paper_metadata.title: Local Government Development Program and participatory planning in Uganda

program_information.region: Kampala (four parishes: Mulago II, Kisasi, Bwaise III and Mpererwe)

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Funding was provided as Conditional and non-conditional grants released in each financial year for two grouped items of Local Development Grants (LDG) and Capacity Building Grants (CBG)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The services included health, education, street lighting, water supply, drainage, waste collection among others as provided for by the Local Governments Act
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: The research was based on a case study design based on four administrative parishes

bonus_information.qualitative_evidence_citation: Focus Group Discussions were held in each study site to elicit data on community needs, priorities, resources available and opportunities for improvement in implementation of development plans. Additional interviews were also conducted with technocrats and project implementers.

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: Government of Uganda implemented the Local Government Development Program (LGDP) between 2000 and 2009 with support from multi-lateral and bi-lateral agencies
evidence_citations.country_citation: Government of Uganda implemented the Local Government Development Program (LGDP) between 2000 and 2009
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The participatory approach involved improvement of service delivery where local communities identified, prioritized and implemented development projects
